channel.title: Ubuntu Client Configuration :: CIS 527 Textbook
channel.description: Resources SSSD and LDAP on Ubuntu Server Guide Video Transcript Once we’ve set up and configured our OpenLDAP server on Linux, we can configure another VM to act as an LDAP client and use that server for authentication. Thankfully, now that Ubuntu 20.04 uses SSSD, this process is pretty simple. For the most part, we’ll be following the instructions in the Ubuntu Server Guide page linked below this video. It is a pretty in-depth overview of how to configure SSSD to use LDAP for authentication.
